documents.title: Introduction to Coolify
documents.description: Coolify is an open-source self-hosted PaaS alternative to Vercel, Heroku, and Railway with unlimited deployments, no vendor lock-in, and free SSL.
documents.summary: This document introduces Coolify, an open-source self-hosting platform that allows developers to manage and deploy applications, databases, and services on their own servers.

documents.title: Installation
documents.description: Install Coolify self-hosted PaaS on Linux servers with automated Docker setup script, manual configuration, SSH access, and firewall setup.
documents.summary: This document provides comprehensive instructions and prerequisites for installing the self-hosted version of Coolify on various Linux distributions.

documents.title: Coolify Cloud
documents.description: Coolify Cloud is a fully managed PaaS service with zero maintenance, automatic scaling, daily backups, and email notifications.
documents.summary: This document introduces Coolify Cloud, a managed service for the Coolify platform, detailing its benefits, pricing model, and the process for connecting external servers. It explains the advantages of a managed control plane, such as automated backups and maintenance, while maintaining compatibility with self-hosted infrastructure.

documents.title: Usage
documents.description: Compare Coolify Cloud managed service starting at $5/month versus free self-hosted deployment with maintenance, support, and backup differences.
documents.summary: This document compares the features, maintenance requirements, and costs of Coolify Cloud versus self-hosting to help users decide which deployment method suits their needs.
